io.elegie.luchess.pgn.impl.tokens

Class TerminationToken

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.elegie.luchess.pgn.impl.tokens.AbstractToken
      • io.elegie.luchess.pgn.impl.tokens.TerminationToken
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Token
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TerminationWithNumber1Token, TerminationWithoutNumber1Token

    public abstract class TerminationToken
extends AbstractToken

    A Termination token marks the end of a game. It should be equal to the value of the tag "Result". Possible outcomes include "1-0", "0-1", "1/2-1/2", and "*" (an unfinished game).

    Some termination tokens start with the number 1, which may be conflicting with other tokens (such as a move number). We need a convention. All termination tokens starting with the number 1 shall in fact be implemented with two separate tokens: the first part being the number 1 (using Number1Token) and the second part being the remainder of the token ( TerminationWithNumber1Token ). Other termination tokens are implemented with a single token class ( TerminationWithoutNumber1Token ).

    • Method Detail

      • interpret

        public int interpret(int data,
            java.io.Reader reader,
            ParserVisitor visitor)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     ParseException
        Description copied from interface: Token
        This is the method in charge of consuming the text stream provided by the token. The Parser always calls the 'accepts' method prior to this one.
        Parameters:
        data - The current character in the stream.
        reader - A reader to the stream.
        visitor - The visitor to notify when the token has consumed all the necessary chars.
        Returns:
        The character the stream ends on, once the token has consumed all relevant chars.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When the reader cannot be accessed.
        ParseException - When the initial char has been accepted, but that the next incoming chars are not expected.
